sourceDesc.p: TEI-page files converted by Python to TEI-entry file

div.p: SACÆA, a feaſt which the ancient Babylonians and other orientals held annually in honour of the deity Anaitis. The Sacæa were in the Eaſt what the Saturnalia were at Rome, viz. a feaſt for the ſlaves. One of the ceremonies was to chooſe a priſoner condemned to death, and allow him all the pleaſures and gratifications he would wiſh, before he were carried to execution.
